result.execSummary:
The defendant Scott Allen Kluck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
Milwaukee Day Reporting Center. Follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
Mental health evaluation.  Take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
Actively engage in treatment and/or counseling.
Vocational training
AODA assessment. Comply with recommended treatment.  Absolute sobriety. Random urine screens and breathalzyers.

No contact with ex-wife L.M.K.
No contact with firearms.

Provide DNA sample.
All mandatory court costs, fees and assessment including DNA surcharge.  To be paid during the period of probation. If revoked to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
-Court waives all nonmandtory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.

Court advised defendant of right to seek postconviction relief.
Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

timeConds.notes:
10 days to be served upfront. 
The remainder 90 days IMPOSED AND STAYED: to be used as determined by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Scott Allen Kluck

records.addlTxt: Notice of right to seek postconviction relief.
Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense.  Signed and Filed.  nk

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck in court, in custody.  Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Scott Allen Kluck.  Attorney Samuel E Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Case in court for plea/sentencing hearing. Plea hearing proceeded. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  Defendant changes his plea to GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Defendant advised that if not a United States Citizen, that a plea of guilty or no contest to the crime you are charged may result in deportation, exclusion from admission to this country, or the denial of naturalization under federal law is possible.  Court found that defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights.  Guilty Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea.  Court found defendant guilty and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. 

Sentencing proceeded. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant. 

AS TO COUNT 1.  The court sentenced the defendant to a MAXIMUM term in the Wisconsin State Prison of 4 YEARS, concurrent to case 21CF269, with credit for 207 days time served, the term of INITIAL CONFINEMENT is 2 YEARS, the term of EXTENDED SUPERVISION is 2 YEARS. Court IMPOSED AND STAYED sentence and placed defendant on PROBATION for 2 YEARS.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION AND EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-100 DAYS in House of Correction as Condition Time; 10 days to be served upfront. The remainder 90 days, Court IMPOSE AND STAYED; to be used as determined by the agent.
-Milwaukee Day Reporting Center; follow through and comply with any recommended treatment.
-Mental health evaluation, take all prescribed medications and follow through and comply with any recommended treatment. 
-AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
-Absolute sobriety; random urine screens and breathalyzers.
-Actively engage in treatment and/or counseling.
-No contact with ex-wife; L.M.K.
-Vocational Training.
-No contact with firearms.
-Provide DNA Sample.
-100 hours community service; to be completed during probation. 
-Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
-Restitution set at zero.
-All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments, including DNA surcharge, to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program OR the Wisconsin Substance Abuse Program.
*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, body armor, explosives and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored. 

Filed: Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights, Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement, Addendum to Plea Questionnaire and Waiver of Rights.
Plea Questionnaire/ Waiver of Rights.  Received and Filed.  nk
Jury Instructions.  Received and Filed.  nk
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement.  Received and Filed.  nk

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court for Scott Allen Kluck.  Attorney Samuel E. Simpson in court for State of Wisconsin. Defendant Scott Allen Kluck not in court, in custody. Case adjourned for global resolution with cases 20CM89 and 20CF269.
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 20, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Scott Allen Kluck in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 38, Judge Wagner. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant.   
*All parties are notified that effective July 30, 2022 this case will be assigned to Judge Laura A. Crivello, Branch 36,  in Room 316SB  Scheduling conference scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck not in court, defendant in custody.  Samuel E. Simpson appeared for the State of Wisconsin.   Deputy Court Clerk: STW
Case set for Status Conference. Attorney Thomas Reed on behalf of Public Defenders office appeared and provided an update to the court. Court will appoint counsel on this matter. Court found defendant is eligible for appointment of counsel by court.  Defendant requested court appointed counsel and agreed to reimburse Milwaukee County for the expense. The court appointed Attorney Thomas Harris, present in court, to represent defendant in this matter at County expense and at the rate of $100.00 per hour. The court ordered the defendant repay the County at a rate of $25.00 per month beginning at 10-1-2022, and then the 1st of each month there after. Court advised defendant failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. Signed, Distributed & Filed, Order Appointing Attorney at County Expense. 

Case needs to be set for preliminary hearing. Court found CAUSE to waive limits. Case is adjourned, Branch 38.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 21, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Case not calendared in Branch 38 this morning. Attorney Tom Reed from the Public Defender's office informed the clerk they have not appointed counsel. Case adjourned July 8, 2022 at 8:15 am, Branch 38.

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck not in court, defendant in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminay hearing. State witness present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a State V-LEE hearing.  Matter to be heard in Br. 35 for Br.38.  Indigency hearing scheduled for June 7, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for June 2, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck not in court, defendant in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is present. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.

Court ordered no contact with Darrel.P and Yvonne.P
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Scott Allen Kluck in court with attorney Connor Romenesko.  Defendant Scott Allen Kluck in custody.  Stephan Eduard Nolten appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Scott Allen Kluck appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Wagner, Branch 38.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 11, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
